alert.note: Alert for Bienville (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 8:10PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Louisiana and northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, in north central Louisiana, Caldwell, Grant, Jackson, La Salle, Ouachita and Winn. In northwest Louisiana, Bienville. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winnfield, Jonesboro, Jena, Olla, Clarks, Grayson, Midway, Urania, Chatham, Pollock, Tullos, Dodson, Georgetown, Sikes, Standard, Rochelle, Burlington, Zenoria, Spaulding and Kelly.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
